snippet: Scott T. Lewis was given 120 years in prison after he was convicted of a double homicide, but a federal judge ruled that evidence about a key witness had been withheld.
abstract: Federal Judge Charles S Haight Jr rules prosecution withheld evidence against Scott T Lewis, man convicted of double homicide in New Haven in 1990, and he must be released within 60 days unless Connecticut decides to retry him; rules Lewis should have been allowed to present evidence at his trial that the key witness against him was coached by a police detective, Vincent Raucci, who retired in 1996.
lead_paragraph: Scott T. Lewis was given 120 years in prison after he was convicted of a double homicide, but a federal judge ruled that evidence about a key witness had been withheld.

headline.main: Judge Orders Freedom or Retrial for Connecticut Man Jailed Since ’95
headline.print_headline: Free or Retry Man Jailed Since ’95, U.S. Judge Rules
